answers.answer: Hi, with so many abdominal surgeries there is the probability of having adhesions inside the abdomen. This is due to the fibrous tissue that forms after surgeries. If there is a complete obstruction then adhesiolysis may be done. For now eat healthy and include plenty of organic yogurt in your diet. Try to take high fibre diet and see if it helps. Regards.

question: Hi all. I am new to this website and hope you can help me out. I am a 34 yr. old female. I have diabetes ( insulin dependent ), osteopenia, a high rheumatoid factor, and high alt and ast liver tests. I've had a c- section, gallbladder removal, vaginal birth w/episiotomy , and a complete hysterectomy . All by 22 yrs. old. For years I have had gastrointestinal issues.severe stomach pain, severe constipation, and sometimes will vomit for days. I had a colonoscopy and the one down my throat with no results. I will go for weeks with no bm's , but when I do have them I will get severe pains across my hysterectomy scar. Any Ideas why?
title: Severe pains across old hysterectomy scar. Why?
